comments:
We have written a plug-in component and we have our customized the project 
creation, file creation.
We have written our plug-in using Eclipse 3.0.1 and now when I tried 
migrating the component to Eclipse 3.1M6, following is happening:
 
1) The moment, I am clicking on Create project icon from Eclipse action 
bar, I am getting the following stack trace and project creation wizard 
doesn't come up. I tried debugging it but it is coming out from 
WizardDialog.class.
Suprisingly, if I am doing File->New->Create my project, then I am able to 
see the wizard and I can create the project.
 
2) For file creation, I am able to bring up the dialog using both action 
and File->new->MyFile.
 
Can you please help? I am clueless, why I am getting such error.

Stefan, can you comment?
*** Bug 91788 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

This is looking like a serious migration problem but we need some steps to
replicate. I tried deleting the icons from the plug-in.xml but that didn't make
this happen.

bug 91788 has more information. The problematic image is coming from:

ImageDescriptor.createFromFile(Wizard.class, "images/page.gif")

...and it's declared in Wizard.java. I suspect we could replicate by writing a
wizard that uses the default image inherited from Wizard.java. My guess is that
createFromFile is not able to find an image that's embedded inside a .jar file.

All of our images are currently coming from jars so it is likely a more specific
case than that.

We need to be on the lookout for these cases as this will affect fragments as
well which are shipping with icons for the first time.
*** Bug 98349 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
This may also be related to Bug 92193 (fixed in RC1)
Stefan what is the plan for this for 3.1?

The stack trace indicates that the problem is that the resource manager is
assuming that the page.gif image exists (which it currently does in JFace).

I have traced through this this morning using a custom wizard I whipped up and
it is working as expected currently (it is loading the default wizard image).

I think this can be closed unless there is some other thing I am missing in your
steps. Ashish could you attach an example that we can test with?

I have just run your example and I noticed that your required plug-ins have the
path 
F:\eclipse_3.1M6\plugins\org.eclipse.jdt.ui_3.1.0\jdt.jar
F:\eclipse_3.1M6\plugins\org.eclipse.ui.ide_3.1.0.jar

I tried using the M6 plugins in RC1 and it still worked for me but I suspect
that your workspace might be pointing at other obsolete jars.

I then updated the build path to use the RC1 plugins and it also worked. If you
create this project using RC1 plugins (i.e. with no external jars in a fresh
workspace) does this still occur?
Adding Raghavendra S B to the cc list.
